Add milk, and continue mashing.
Place in a large serving bowl, and sprinkle with Rosemary Sea Salt.
Serve immediately.
title: BLACK TRUFFLE AND ROSEMARY SEA SALT MASHED POTATOES RECIPE

steps: Make 3 scoops of peanut butter ice cream in a plate, surrounded by banana slices.
Top ice cream with caramel sauce, whipped cream and Spanish peanuts.
Garnish with 1 basil sprig and serve!
title: One Night in Bangkok Sundae

elements.name: Jenis Chocolate Hazelnut Ice Cream Sandwich

steps: Open the box and enjoy the savory sweetness!
title: Chocolate Hazelnut Ice Cream Sandwich

elements.name: Mother In Law's Kimchi Gochujang Paste

steps: Halve the cucumbers lengthwise, then cut them into 1/8 inch diagonal slices.
In a medium bowl, mix cucumbers with 2 tbsp of any Gochujang sauce until well combined.
Serve immediately or refrigerate to enjoy later.
title: Instant Gochujang Cucumber Kimchi Salad

elements.name: Mother In Law's Kimchi Korean chile pepper flakes

steps: In a large bowl, toss the radishes with the salt. Let stand for 20 minutes.
To make the seasoning paste, in a small bowl, combine the broth, chile pepper flakes, ginger, garlic, and sugar. Set aside.
Drain the radishes in a colander set over a bowl, reserving the brined juice. Rinse any excess salt off the radishes and let drain for another 15 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the radishes with the seasoning paste and toss until coated.
Pack the radishes into a quart-size jar. Pour the reserved brining liquid to the bowl.
Pour into the jar, cover with a lid, and let sit at room temperature for 1 day.
title: Mother-in-Law's French Breakfast Radish Kimchi

elements.name: Mother in Law's Napa Cabbage Kimchi

steps: Preheat the oven to 350 F.
Combine ingredients for sauce and pork loin in a Le Creuset pot. Roast pork in oven covered for 1.5 hours.
Remove pork and chop.
Heat soft corn tacos in skillet over medium heat. Plate taco with chopped pork, Mother in law's Napa Kimchi, jalapeno, cilantro and lime wedges to garnish.
title: Spicy Kimchi Tacos

elements.name: Mother in Law's Napa Cabbage Kimchi

steps: Bring 1 quart of salted water to boil.
Add shrimp to boiling water and cook for 1 minute.
Drain all water, add cooked shrimp to a glass bowl with all combined ingredients. Allow to marinate in fridge for two hours.
Serve in martini glass, garnish with a slice of lime and fresh cilantro leaves. Serve with tortilla chips.
title: Mother-in-Law's Spicy Kimchi Ceviche

elements.name: Mother in Law's Vegan Napa Cabbage Kimchi

steps: Combine first 5 ingredients in processor. Blend until smooth.
Transfer to a chilled glass. Add garnishes and serve immediately.
title: Spicy Kimchi Bloody Mary

elements.name: Mother in Law's White Napa Cabbage Kimchi

steps: Heat a cast iron skillet medium-high, add bacon and sausage slices to cook.
When ready, remove from pan. Layout rice crackers, layer bacon, sausage, kimchi and finely chopped chive on top.
Serve on a platter!
title: Kimchi Bacon or Sausage with Rice Crackers

elements.name: Mother in Law's White Napa Cabbage Kimchi

steps: Butter the slices of bread on one side and place them on the skillet, butter side down.
Distribute the cheese evenly on half of the bread slices and cook until slightly melted. Place the kimchi on top of the cheese, top with the remaining toasty bread slices and cook for 1 minute more.
Using a spatula, flip the sandwich and cook for 1 minute longer.
Remove from the pan and cut each sandwich in half.
Serve hot.
title: Grilled Kimcheez Sandwich

steps: Preheat oven to 425 F. Thaw phyllo sheets; melt butter. In a bowl, combine bananas, sugar, and chocolate.
Lay 1 phyllo sheet on a clean work surface. Brush with butter; sprinkle with sugar. Top with another sheet. Repeat with remaining phyllo, brushing each sheet with melted butter as you stack them.

Form 4 triangles: Cut dough into strips with a sharp knife; place filling at one end, leaving one corner empty. Fold corner of dough over filling. Continue folding, alternating corners. When reaching end, trim excess dough. Brush surface with butter.
Bake on a baking sheet for 10-15 minutes. Cool slightly; serve.
title: Banana and Chocolate Triangles

steps: Whisk milk, brown sugar, and whipping cream in heavy large saucepan over medium heat until mixture begins to simmer.
Reduce heat to medium-low; add cocoa powder, chocolate, and cinnamon; whisk until chocolate is melted and smooth.
Pour hot chocolate into 6 demitasse cups. Garnish each with whipped cream and a cinnamon stick.
title: Spiced Hot Chocolate

steps: Melt the chocolate in a double boiler over medium heat.
Once the chocolate is melted, take it off the heat and add the olive oil and cocoa powder. Stir to combine.
Add the salt to taste.
Stored in a jar with a lid. Serve on toasted sourdough bread with an extra sprinkle of sea salt.
title: Chocolate Olive Oil Spread

elements.name: Seattle Chocolates Extreme Dark Truffle Bars

steps: Preheat the oven to 350 F.
Place the first 8 dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl and mix well. Combine the remaining wet ingredients in another large bowl. Add the wet to dry and mix well. Refrigerate for 15 minutes.
Place 8 scoops on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and flatten them with your hand. Space them evenly.
Bake approximately 10 minutes. Allow them to cool before enjoying.
title: Vegan Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps: Bring ginger, honey, and water to a boil over high heat in a medium pot. Reduce heat to medium and let simmer 5 minutes.
Peel pears and halve lengthwise. Use a melon baller to scoop out cores. Gently lower pears into pot. Cover surface with a round of parchment paper.
Cook pears about 10-15 minutes. Remove and transfer to a bowl. Pour poaching liquid over.
To serve, place pear halves in a bowl and drizzle with melted chocolate.
title: Poached Pears with Dark Chocolate

elements.name: Seattle Chocolate Dark Chocolate Truffle Bar
Jcoco Cayenne Veracruz Orange White Chocolate

steps: Preheat oven to 450 F. Line baking sheet with parchment.
Roll out dough on lightly floured surface to 11-inch round. Transfer dough to prepared sheet. Make indentations all over dough. Brush melted butter over.
Bake about 20 minutes.
Smooth chocolate-hazelnut spread over hot crust. Sprinkle chopped bittersweet chocolate and white chocolate over.
Bake about 2 minutes. Sprinkle chopped hazelnuts over, cut into wedges, and serve.
title: Chocolate Pizza

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co. Raspberry Simple Syrup
Shari's Berries Gourmet Dipped Swizzled Strawberries

steps: Stir together champagne, raspberry carbonated water, and raspberry simple syrup in a large measuring cup. Once mixed together, add food coloring.
Pour in chilled glass and add a pink rock candy pop to jazz up.
Pair it with chocolate covered strawberries & festive m&m’s in adorable baking cups for the party!
title: Raspberry Champagne Spritzer

steps: Cream the butter, sugar, and powdered sugar together with an electric mixer. Add the egg yolk, vanilla, almond extract, and salt and stir on medium speed. Turn the mixer down to low speed and add the flour.
Transfer the dough to a floured surface. Knead the dough until it forms a solid ball.
Use a rolling pin to roll the dough out to 1/4 inch thick. Cut 1.5-2 inch circles out with cookie cutter and place the cookies on a parchment-covered cookie sheet.
Bake at 375 F for 7-10 minutes. Take them out right when they are starting to brown. Cool cookies completely.

To dip, melt almond bark in a glass bowl. Add in food coloring and mix until color is smooth.Using a fork, carefully dip each cookie into the bark and tap excess bark off. Top with sprinkles and allow to full harden before enjoying!
title: Frosted Animal Cookie Wafers

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co Vanilla Bean Infused Simple Syrup
Sonoma Syrup Co Organic Vanilla Extract

steps: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend for 20-30 seconds until ice is crushed and mixture is incorporated.
Pour in glass cup and serve immediately for best consistency.
title: Vanilla Cake Batter Frappuccino
Festive Valentine’s Day Party with Sonoma Syrup
steps: Make Raspberry Champagne Spritzers.
Make Strawberry Cream Vanilla Bean Frappuccinos.
Make Frosted Animal Cookie Wafers.
Pair with  chocolate covered strawberries & festive m&m’s and you have a Valentine party!
Mix over ice in a Moscow Mule copper cup and top off with club soda.
Garnish with lime zest and imbibe with a straw.
title: Moscow Mule Set

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co. Lime Infused Simple Syrup

steps: Put egg yolks and lime syrup into a medium sized saucepan. Cook over low heat, add butter in small pieces stirring constantly for 12 minutes, until mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and cool.
Pour the cooled lime curd into your favorite baked tart shells and chill until set.
Garnish with berries.
title: Lime Curd Tart

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co. mint infused simple syrup

steps: Pour ingredients into a 10-14 oz silver julep cup. Add mint leaves and fill with crushed ice.
Agitate with mixing spoon until outside of cup is frosty. Top with a splash of brandy and garnish with a mint sprig.
title: Sonoma Syrup Mint Julep

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co. Meyer Lemon Infused Simple Syrup

steps: Make a cup of Hibiscus Sangria ice tea.
Add a few drops of meyer lemon simple syrup.
Garnish with one lemon slice.
title: Meyer Lemon Ice Tea

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co. Vanilla Bean Extract “Crush”

steps: Preheat the oven to 325 F.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs, then stir in vanilla extract.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture until just blended. Mix in the quick oats, walnuts, and chocolate chips.
Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
title: Oatmeal Raisin Chocolate Chip Cookies

elements.name: Wine Forest Dried Black Trumpet Mushrooms

intro: Tom Worthington of San Francisco's Monterey Fish Market finds the combination of local wild Dungeness Crab and wild black trumpet mushrooms a natural. This brightly and deeply flavored salad focuses these seasonal ingredients in a way that works year-round.
steps: Rehydrate dried black trumpets, tearing them into strips.
Add 2 tbsp olive oil to a skillet over a medium-low flame, add the mushrooms, lemon zest, garlic and a pinch of salt. Sauté mushrooms about 5-8 minutes. Set aside to cool.
For the dressing, combine the shallot and vinegar in a bowl and let stand 15 minutes. Whisk in the remaining 4 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice and a pinch of salt.
Combine the watercress and salad greens in a bowl and dress to taste. In separate bowls dress the avocado and the crab meat & mushrooms to taste.
Arrange the avocado and greens on the plates and top with the crab and mushrooms.
Salt and pepper to taste.
title: Dungeness Crab & Black Trumpet Salad

elements.name: Wine Forest Dried Candy Cap Mushroom

intro: The haunting maple flavor of Candy Cap Mushrooms makes this so much more than a great side dish. This wintery squash can also become the base of a magnificent butternut squash soup.
steps: Preheat the oven to 325 F.
Soak crushed up dried Candy Cap Mushrooms in the lukewarm water for 15 minutes. Chop the re-hydrated mushroom finely.
In sauté pan, add mushrooms and butter and sauté for 2 minutes on medium high heat. Pour reserved Candy Cap water into sauté pan. Boil and reduce volume to about 1/4 cup gravy.
Put squash cut side up in small roasting pan. Salt and pepper squash surface.
Spoon the gravy onto squash. Cover with foil and bake for 1.5 hour.
title: Candy Cap Mushrooms on Butternut Squash

intro: Our Wine Forest Mushroom Alchemy makes as perfect a coating for vegetables as is does for meats. This super-simple process for roasting vegetables yields flavor that is anything but ordinary.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 F.
Pour the olive oil into a large bowl.
Divide the head of cauliflower into bite-sized sections.
Toss cauliflower with the olive oil until lightly coated.
Sprinkle the Mushroom Alchemy over the cauliflower evenly. Sprinkle with salt.
Bake cauliflower in oven for about 25 minutes.
title: Roasted Mushroomed Cauliflower

intro: The bright, balanced flavors of our Wine Forest Fennel Pollen Rub are beautifully paired with impeccably fresh, cold wild fish in its most pure form.
steps: In a small bowl, allow the fresh lemon peels to mascerate in the olive oil for 15 minutes. Remove the lemon peel.
Arrange the sliced wild fish on a chilled plate.
Drizzle the olive oil over the fish.
Sprinkle with Fennel Pollen Rub and serve.
title: Crudo of Wild Fish with Fennel

intro: Here's a healthy, hearty and easy-to-make Wine Forest Forest Farro soup that will take the chill off in an instant.
steps: Combine the Forest Farro, the stock and salt in a large pan over medium heat and cook for 30 minutes.
Finish with the butter and pepper to taste.
title: Forest Farro Soup

intro: This tangy, spicy sauce with a touch of smoke and notes of blackfruit will only add to the finger-licking-ness of any BBQ.
steps: Combine ingredients in a sauce pan.
Over a medium flame, bring the sauce to a simmer and cook about 12 minutes.
Apply the sauce to the grilled meat with a natural bristle culinary brush during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Let the lemon ends stay and continue to lend to the flavor.
title: Wild Elderberry Barbecue Sauce

intro: Gravlax, or cured salmon, is a dish meant to be shared, and more often than not marks a seasonal ocasion, fitting for wild salmon married with wild seasonings.
steps: Remove the pin bones from the salmon.
Combine the sugar, salt and Juniper Berry Rub in a bowl and mix thoroughly.
Sprinkle a thin layer of the curing mixture in a shallow dish large enough to hold the salmon side.
Place the side of salmon onto the layer. Sprinkle the top of the salmon with the rest of the curing mixture.
Cover the dish, let sit at room temperature about 4 hours. Refrigerate for 36-48 hours. Once cured, scrape the curing mixture from the surface and pat with paper towels.
Transfer the salmon to a cutting board, remove the skin and thinly slice the salmon.
Serve with whole grain bread and creme fraiche.
title: Gravlax with Wild Juniper

steps: Combine the sugar and bourbon in an 8 oz mug.
Pour in 3/4 cup boiling water and stir to dissolve the sugar.
Add the lemon peel and serve.
title: Candy Cap Hot Bourbon

intro: Cool and refreshing with some zip and a touch of sweetness
steps: Combine the yogurt, Huckleberry Shrub, fresh mint and sparkling water in a blender.
Blend well, until mint is nicely incorporated.
Add the crushed ice and a pinch of salt.
Blend until smooth.
Garnish with a sprig of mint and serve immediately.
title: Huckleberry Mint Lassi

steps: Combine all of the liquid ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into an ice-filled martini glass.
Garnish with a Wine Forest Pickled Cocktail Chanterelle.
title: Chanterelle Martini

elements.name: Sonoma Syrup Co. Classic Simple Syrup

steps: Combine the first 5 ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into an ice-filled Collins or rocks glass.
Top with the soda water. Stir to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
title: Devil's Shrub

intro: Sweet, salty, crunchy, maple toasty, spicy disappearing acts. Prepare these with Wild Pecans or Wild Black Walnuts for more intensity of flavor.
steps: Preheat the oven to 275 F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with vegetable oil.
Combine the brown sugar, Candy Cap Sugar, cayenne pepper, cinnamon amd sea salt in a bowl.
In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the egg white until stiff.
Add the vanilla and dried ingredients and fold them into the egg whites. Fold in the pecans, coating them.
Turn the coated nuts out onto the parchment paper. Bake 20-30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool. Lift the crunchy nuts off the paper in chunks. Store in an airtight container.
title: Candy Cap Candied Nuts

intro: Grilled vegetables are edging out other ingredients for space on your grill's dance floor, and having some warm olive oil on hand that's been pre-flavored with our Wine Forest Porcini Salt makes glazing these goodies as easy as stroking a brush.
steps: Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan. Add the Porcini Salt and stir for a minute.
In a medium saucepan, combine the water with the lemon, thyme, olive oil, salt, garlic, and chile flakes. Bring to a boil, then turn off heat and let simmer 10 minutes.
Trim artichoke hearts to the tasty bath. Heat the water to cook the artichoke hearts. As they near being cooked, remove from the heat and allow to cook further about 30 minutes.
Drain the warm artichokes and remove the thyme springs, garlic, and lemon halves.
Pour off the warm olive oil into a container. Grill the slices of porcini and wedges of artichoke hearts until tender, brushing on the flavored oil. Sprinkle with Porcini Salt to taste.
title: Grilled Artichokes with Porcini

steps: In a large saucepan, heat vegetable oil & sauté shallots until tender & fragrant.
Add beer and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add heavy cream and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
In a separate pan melt butter and incorporate flour. Stir with a wooden spoon over low heat for 5-7 minutes.
While soup is simmering slowly add small amounts of butter/flour mixture to the soup while whisking until desire thickness achieved.
Add cheese. Do not bring to a boil after adding the cheese.
title: BLACK PEPPER BELLAVITANO BEER CHEESE SOUP

elements.name: Willamette Valley Sweet 'N Hot Stone Ground Mustard

steps: Cut beans into 2 inch pieces.
Cook beans in boiling water until al dente.
Shock in ice water to stop cooking process. Drain and pat dry.
Place balsamic vinegar and mustard in a large mixing bowl. Whisk together. Slowly whisk in olive oil.
Add beans, artichoke hearts, red pepper, basil and half of both cheeses. Toss together. Season with salt & pepper.
Place in serving bowl & garnish with remaining cheeses. Chill until ready to serve.
title: BALSAMIC BELLAVITANO TWO BEAN & ARTICHOKE SALAD

steps: Spread dough from 2 crescent roll cans onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes at 350 F.
Cool.
Mix cream cheese, Greek yogurt and ranch mix together and spread onto pizza base.
Sprinkle veggies on top. Add shredded cheese.
Cut into squares and serve!
title: VEGGIE PIZZA

steps: Cook macaroni. Drain.
Microwave chicken sausage for 2 min and slice.
In a large pot, combine pasta, chicken sausage, cheese, tomatoes, green chilies, salsa verde and spices. Stir to combine.
title: SALSA ASIAGO MAC N' CHEESE

steps: Press dough onto a 12 inch pan to form a crust. Bake at 350 F for 16-20 min.
Cool for 30 min.
Mix cream cheese, sugar, vanilla and Raspberry BellaVitano cheese. Spread on crust.
Top with strawberries and blueberries.
Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
title: SARTORI-STYLE DESSERT PIZZA

steps: For each burger, flatten out 1 patty.
Place 1 oz shredded cheese in the center.
Top with additional patty. Seal edges.
Grill to desired doneness.
Melt butter.
Stir in flour and salt. Gradually add milk, stirring until well mixed.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth.
Cook for 5 minutes more and add cheese. Stir until smooth.
Add the cooked MontAmoré cheese sauce to the patty.
title: MONTAMORÉ STUFFED BURGER

steps: Boil potatoes for 10 min or until tender. Drain.
Mix potatoes with sour cream, yogurt, salt, pepper, onions and Rosemary & Olive Oil Asiago.
Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving cold.
title: ROSEMARY AND OLIVE OIL ASIAGO POTATO SALAD

steps: Combine all ingredients.
Mix well.
Chill overnight before serving.
Serve with pretzels.
title: GARLIC BASIL BELLAVITANO SPREAD

steps: Cook pasta.
Bake veggies with garlic, olive oil, salt & pepper and spices on 450 F for 20-30 min until tender.
Toss pasta, veggies, sauce and cheese together.
In a 9x13 pan, bake until top is golden.
title: SARTORI BAKED ZITI

steps: Toast walnuts in pan over medium heat until fragrant.
Compile the cheese, pear, and walnuts onto one piece of bread in skillet, buttered side down.
Lightly drizzle with honey and sprinkle with chopped rosemary.
Top with last piece of bread, buttered side up.
Cook each side on medium heat until golden brown.
title: SARTORI PEAR & GORGONZOLA GRILLED CHEESE

steps: Fill each crescent dough with a handful of chocolate chips and shredded Espresso BellaVitano.
Roll the crescent.
Top with additional chocolate chips and shredded cheese.
Bake at 350 F for 12 min.
Serve warm.
title: ESPRESSO BELLAVITANO CRESCENT ROLLS

steps: Whip cream cheese until smooth in a stand mixer.
Add the rest of the ingredients except pecans and parsley. Chill for at least 1 hour to allow flavors to meld.
In a medium bowl, combine pecans and parsley.
Form cheese mixture into 1” balls and roll balls into pecan mixture to coat.
Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 24 hours.
title: Mt. Mazama Mountain Blue Cheese Ball Pops

steps: Preheat oven to 425 F.
Wash and core pear. Do not peel.
In a medium bowl, combine lemon juice and 2 cup cool water.
Slice 12-15 pear slices and immerse in lemon water.Drain.
On a floured surface, roll pizza dough, forming a large, thin rectangle.
Transfer dough to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Top dough with a thin layer of crème fraiche followed by TouVelle.
Space pears evenly around the dough. Bake for 15-18 minutes until crust is browned.
Remove from oven and top with crumbled Caveman, sliced sage and black pepper.
Slice and serve immediately.
title: Pear and Sage Flatbread with Caveman and TouVelle

intro: Delicious savoury croquettes, light and fluffy inside with a crisp breadcrumb coating
steps: Cook the rice in the chicken stock until just soft.
Drain and while still warm stir in the Green Thunder, celery, salt and pepper and one beaten egg. Allow the mixture to cool, and then shape into small croquette shapes.
Whisk the eggs, dip the croquettes into the flour then the egg wash, and finally into the breadcrumbs.
Deep fry at 190°C for 3-4 minutes.
title: Rice & Celery croquettes starring Green Thunder

intro: A light and fluffy soufflé with rich interior using the finest aged red Leicester.
steps: Bring the milk to the boil with the onion, cloves, bay leaf and the nutmeg.
Make a roux with the butter and flour.
Gradually add the milk to the roux to form a thick white sauce.
Take the sauce from the heat and stir in the Red Storm, chives and the egg yolks.
Whip up the egg white and fold into the soufflé.
Pour the mixture into buttered ramekins lined with grated parmesan.
Bake in a Bain Marie at 300 F for approximately 20mins.
Serve straight away with a salad of your choice.
title: Twice Baked Storming Soufflés

intro: Plump oysters served on crushed new potatoes with an extra mature cheddar and whisky sauce.
steps: Cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender. Drain, place in a bowl, add the milk, olive oil and chervil.
Crush coarsely with a fork, season and keep warm.
Open the oysters, reserving the juice in a bowl. Discard the top shell.

To make the sauce, whisk the egg yolks and wine in a small bowl over a pan of simmering water until the mixture thickens and doubles in volume. Boil the cream and the Amber Mist together for 2-3 mins then fold into the whisked egg mixture. Add the oyster juice and mix well.
Divide the crushed potatoes between the oyster shells. Season the oysters and place onto the potatoes. Spoon over the sauce.
Place under a hot grill for 4-5 mins until golden and serve.
title: Misty Glazed Oysters on crushed New Potatoes

intro: The ultimate extra mature cheddar tart served with a sweet port and grape dressing.
steps: Roll out the pastry and line 4 tartlet tins. Blind bake them until set.
Dice the leeks, chop the walnuts and gently sweat off until soft.
Place the leeks and walnuts into the pastry tartlets. Cut the Black Bomber cheese to small cubes and arrange on top of the tartlets.
Mix the eggs, the cream and season, then pour over the tartlets and bake in a hot oven until set.
Reduce the Port in a pan, then add the cider vinegar, olive oil and the grapes.
title: Leek & Bomber Tart with Walnuts and a Port & Brandy dressing

intro: Upgrade your morning routine with these quick and easy baked eggs from, made with crème fraîche, arugula, swiss chard, and goat cheese.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 F. Split the swiss chard and arugula between four large ramekins.
In a small bowl, mix together the heavy cream and Vermont Creamery crème fraîche. Divide the mixture into 4 and pour on top of the swiss chard and arugula, stir gently.
Crack the eggs into the ramekins and sprinkle on salt and pepper. Place on baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes. Top each ramekin with goat cheese and serve.
title: crème fraîche baked eggs
stove-top bacon mushroom crème fraîche macaroni and cheese
intro: Cheesy goodness, crispy crunchy bacon, and creamy crème fraîche star in our take on the king of comfort foods!
steps: Preheat oven to 350 F. Lay flat bacon on cooking sheet and cook in the oven for 20 minutes. Remove to pat grease off with paper towel.
Crack egg in a small bowl and whisk. Slice mushrooms and add to a small skillet with cooking oil.
Cook macaroni in a large pot. Drain with a strainer and wash with cool water to prevent sticking.
In a separate pot, melt butter under medium low heat and sprinkle flour over top while whisking. Cook for 5 minutes while whisking.
Add the dry mustard and milk. Turn the heat to low and mix in the milk and mustard. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Combine 1 cup of the hot sauce into the whisked egg and whisk together. Pour egg mixture into the sauce.
Add grated cheese and crème fraîche and stir until cheese is melted.
Add pepper, salt, elbow noodles and mushrooms to the mixture. Crumble bacon into pieces and add to the pot, stir to incorporate.

intro: This unlikely combination of Cremont, banana, pancetta, and tarragon is sweet, savory and melts in your mouth. Perfect for an unexpected cheese dessert course.
steps: Preheat the oven at 400 F.
Slice the goat cheese to obtain 2 thick slices. Take the leaves of tarragon off the stems and cisel it. Cut the bananas into bite size.
Take 2 ramkins. In each, sprinkle half the shallot, add the banana pieces, a slice pancetta, then the slice of goat cheese.
Add the tarragon, drizzle the heavy cream on top, and add a dash of salt and fresh ground pepper.
Cook in the oven for about 25 minutes.
Serve while hot.
title: banana goat cheese cassolette

intro: This fiery, fat-free recipe for Fromage Blanc Horseradish Sauce is the perfect complement to a pepper crusted beef tenderloin.
steps: Whisk Fromage blanc, horseradish, lemon zest, pepper and salt in a medium bowl.
Chill until ready to serve.
title: fat-free horseradish cream sauce

steps: Halve the cucumber lengthwise and remove seeds. Blot dry with paper towels.Cut to small cubes.
Combine all the ingredients and blend in ice water to reach a smooth soupy consistency. Refrigerate the soup for 1 hour before serving.
title: cold quark & cucumber soup

intro: These adorable treats are a delight and will remind you of classic turtle candies with their crunchy pecans, delicious chocolate and drizzled caramel. These are even better with ARCTIC ZERO Buttery Pecan as their centerpiece!
steps: Add a parchment paper to a baking sheet. Scoop out the Arctic Zero into 2-3 inch balls. Place on the baking sheet, into the freezer to harden.
Once the balls are done, melt the chocolate chips and vegetable shortening on low heat on the stovetop.
Place a sheet of parchment paper on another baking sheet.
One at a time, drizzle the chocolate over the ball to cover it.
Quickly transfer the dipped ball to the second baking sheet. While the chocolate is soft, place 4 pecans flat around the bottom of the balls, sprinkle the chopped pecans over the top.
Drizzle the caramel sauce over the tops of each truffle when serve.
title: Buttery Pecan Frozen Turtle Truffles

intro: This ice cream truck favorite is easy to make and even better to enjoy with ARCTIC ZERO Cookie Dough Chip. Use your favorite garnishes like whipped topping, chopped nuts, and of course, a crackly chocolate shell poured over the top!
steps: Whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk the milk, water, and egg.
Create a well in the center of the dry ingredients, and add in the wet ingredients.
Mix until well blended and smooth.
Drop the mixture by tablespoon onto a hot pizzelle maker.
Remove from the pizzelle maker and place on a flat surface. Quickly fold the cookie in half to form the shape of a taco.
Add ARCTIC ZERO Cookie Dough Chip Frozen Dessert to the cookie tacos. Place in the freezer until frozen again.
To serve, drizzle with the chocolate sauce, garnish with whipped topping, chopped peanuts, and cherries.
title: Cookie Dough Chip Chocolaty Tacos

intro: Indulge in this cool and refreshing summer treat at half the calories!
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 F.
Place 4 cupcake liners in a cupcake pan and spray with cooking spray.
In a small bowl, beat the canola oil, milk, egg white, vanilla and sugar together until combined.
Stir in the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Spoon 2 tbsp of batter into each cupcake liner.
Bake for 10-13 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Scoop a generous amount of Hint of Mint Cookie Arctic Zero on top.
Drizzle with hot fudge sauce to serve.
title: Mint Chocolate Ice Cream Cupcakes

intro: Escape to the tropics without leaving home! This blended frozen cocktail is full of island-like flavors including rum, pineapple juice and coconut water. Don’t forget the best part: Arctic Zero Toasted Coconut for added flavor and creaminess.
steps: Add the pineapple juice, coconut water, rum, Arctic Zero Toasted Coconut and ice cubes into a blender and blend until creamy.
Serve garnished with cherry, pineapple pieces, and sprinkles of toasted coconut pieces over the top.
title: Toasted Coconut Frozen Piña Colada

intro: This for-adults-only float is sweet and frosty - just the right creamy cocktail to enjoy during the warm weather. The citrus flavors are a vibrant addition to this float made with Orange Dream ARCTIC ZERO.
steps: Add the orange juice, lemon-lime soda and vodka to a 12 oze glass and stir.
Float 2 scoops of Orange Dream ARCTIC ZERO over the other ingredients.
Serve with an orange slice, straw and spoon.
title: Creamy 007 Orange Float

intro: This rustic fruit crisp is an easy to make, one-skillet delight. The icing on the cake, so to speak? A drizzle of caramel sauce and a scoop or two of Arctic Zero Salted Caramel. The flavors pair perfectly for a sweet treat.
steps: Whisk the flour, oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and salt in a bowl.
Add butter cubes and use a pastry cutter to break the cubes and incorporate into the dry mixture.
Preheat the oven to 425 F.
In a large bowl, combine the apple slices, lemon juice, and granulated sugar.
Add 1 tbsp butter to an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
When the butter is melted, add the apple mixture and cook for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle the filling over the top of the apple mixture in the skillet.
Add to the oven and cook for 20-25 minutes until the top is lightly golden. Cool.
Serve the crisp topped with Arctic Zero Salted Caramel and a drizzle of caramel sauce.
title: Salted Caramel Skillet Crisp

intro: Rich, little bites with big flavor: sweet figs, smoky bacon, and creamy chèvre cheese make perfect bites to share as an appetizer.
steps: Chop the pecans and toast in a skillet over medium heat.  Remove right away before they burn.
Preheat the broiler. Stuff fig halves with a small scoop of the chèvre and then top the cheese with toasted pecan bits.
Wrap each stuffed fig with a thick-sliced piece of bacon and secure each one with a toothpick.
Place the wrapped figs on a baking sheet. Broil the figs for 4-7 minutes.
Remove toothpicks and serve.
title: Bacon-Wrapped Figs Stuffed with Chèvre

steps: In a large bowl, combine the flour, cream, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper, whisking to mix. Stir in the cauliflower florets.

In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat, adding the ham and garlic when butter starts to brown. Sauté ham and garlic until the garlic brown slightly. Add the cauliflower mixture to the skillet.
Bring the mixture in the skillet to a low simmer, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens and the cauliflower softens.
Transfer to a greased 2-quart baking dish. Top with shredded Swiss cheese, parsley and place the baking dish into the oven, low broil until the top is lightly browned.
Serve while warm.
title: Cauliflower Au Gratin with Smoked Ham

intro: This is on the list of food to prepare for the weekend: a warm bowl of soup loaded with vegetables and lean, smoky chunks of tender turkey breast. Serve this with fresh, crusty bread and butter.
steps: In a dutch oven, warm the olive oil over medium heat.  Add the fennel and onion to the oil and sauté until onion is just translucent.
Add the smoked turkey, carrots, beans, tomatoes, thyme, bay leaf, and broth to the pan. Simmer for about 45 minutes.
Remove the bay leaf and season with salt and black pepper. Stir the torn spinach into the soup just before serving.
Serve garnished with the grated parmesan cheese.
title: Applewood Smoked Turkey & Fennel Soup with White Beans

steps: Preheat the oven to 350 F.
Whisk together the egg, coconut oil, water and vanilla in a large mixing bowl. Add 1 pkg of Simple Mills Banana Muffin Mix and combine.
Once you have a thin liquid batter, mix in the chocolate chips.
Fold in the coconut flakes and then bake.
After 20 minutes, sprinkle a few coconut flakes on top of loaf and bake for another 10 minutes.
Let cool and serve.
title: Chocolate Chip Coconut Banana Bread

elements.name: Simple Mills Chocolate Muffin & Cupcake Mix

intro: These irresistible raw chocolate-almond macaroons are so easy to make. With only 4 ingredients, they will take you to chocolate heaven. Sweet, nutty, and slightly chewy - a perfect afternoon snack!
steps: Combine all of the listed ingredients except 1 tbsp of coconut in a bowl.
Mix thoroughly until a dough forms.
Scoop the mix and place small mounds of macaroons onto a cookie sheet.
Sprinkle the tops with remaining 1 tbsp of unsweetened shredded coconut.
Place the cookie sheet in the freezer for 10-15 minutes harden.
Enjoy!
title: Raw Chocolate-Almond Macaroons

elements.name: Simple Mills Focaccia & Sandwich bread mix

intro: Try this life altering stuffing recipe made with Simple Mills Focaccia bread mix.
steps: Bake the focaccia bread according to the directions of Simple Mills Focaccia & Sandwich Bread mix bag.
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Cut a loaf of focaccia bread into cubes; toast the cubes in the preheated oven to draw out all of the moisture.
Heat a cast-iron fry pan over medium heat and start sautéing carrots, celery, onion with salt and spices until tender.
Take the toasted cubes out of the oven and transfer into a baking pan.
Pour the sautéed veggies in the pan with broth. Use a ratio of 2 parts focaccia and 1 part broth.
Toss all the ingredients and bake for 40 minutes.
title: The Best Paleo Focaccia Stuffing Recipe Ever

elements.name: Taza Chipotle Chipotle Chili Chocolate Mexicano

intro: A delicious vegetarian chili, enriched with our Chipotle Chocolate Mexicano, is topped with a layer of cheesy tamale goodness. This is a great, hearty dish for casual entertaining, and leftovers reheat beautifully.
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat until shimmering. Add onions and garlic and cook about 3 minutes. Add zucchini and pepper and continue to cook about 4 minutes. Add kidney beans, diced tomato, chili powder and chopped chocolate. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Place in a 13”x9” baking dish.
Bring 3 cups of water and milk to a simmer, add grits and chili flakes and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add scallions and cheese, season to taste with salt and pepper.
Pour chili and top with additional cheese.
Refrigerate overnight.
Serve with sour cream and sliced scallions.
title: Chipotle Vegetable Chili Tamale Pie

intro: We like to use this homemade gravlax as a topper on pretty canapés, with pumpernickel bread and cream cheese. You can also serve it whole on a platter, with an array of crispbreads, capers, red onions, and mustard, and let guests help themselves.
steps: Mix together salt and sugar. Place one filet on a plate, sprinkle with half the nibs, followed by half the thyme, then half the sugar/salt mixture.
Repeat with the other filet then sandwich them together, skin is facing out. Wrap tightly with plastic. Place in the fridge overnight.
Remove the plastic and drain out any liquid. Flip the fish over while keeping as much of the nibs and thyme inside as possible, replace plastic wrap and put back in the fridge for another 24 hours.
Remove the nibs and thyme and rinse salmon under cold water. Slice thinly and serve.
title: Cacao Nib & Thyme Gravlax

intro: Perfect for this chilly season, rich sausage and sweet squash get just a hint of cacao flavor from the addition of Taza Roasted Cacao Nibs. This recipe is Paleo-friendly.
steps: Preheat oven to 375 F. Pierce the flesh of each squash with a fork, then season each squash half with salt.
Place 1/2 tbsp butter in each squash half, then wrap in aluminum foil and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 40 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
In a sauté pan over medium-high heat, cook the sausage until browned, remove. Add onions, garlic, and sage and cook about 4 minutes. Add mushrooms and season with salt. Cook about 10 minutes.
Combine sausage and veggies in a bowl to cool.

Scoop some of the flesh out the acorn squash halves, leaving a 1/2 inch border of squash remaining in the skin. Mash squash with a fork, then fold into the sausage/veggie mixture along with cacao nibs.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, then divide filling among the squash halves.
Place them back in the oven for 20 minutes. Serve warm.
title: Sausage and Cacao Nib Stuffed Acorn Squash

intro: Pecan pie is a guaranteed crowd-pleaser, and our version is even more delicious, due to two not-so-secret ingredients. Less cloyingly sweet than some recipes, our pie gets deep, rich flavor from our 70% Dark Stone Ground Chocolate, and a smoky kick from bourbon.
steps: Preheat to 375 F.
Whisk together eggs, butter, corn syrup, brown sugar, and bourbon until smooth. Add 1 cup pecans and chopped chocolate and mix until combined.
Pour pecan mixture into unbaked pie shell and top with additional pecan halves. Bake for 15 minutes, then turn heat down to 350 F and bake for another 30 minutes.
Allow to cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream, sprinkled with Roasted Cacao Nibs.
title: Chocolate Bourbon Pecan Pie

elements.name: Taza Stone Ground Chocolate Semi-Sweet Baking Squares

intro: This super simple ganache-style dip is luscious with strawberries, banana, apple slices or any combo of your favorite fruits.
steps: In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the chocolate and cream together, stirring constantly until smooth.
Pour into a bowl then serve with a colorful platter of sliced stawberries, pretzels for dipping!
title: Dark Chocolate Fruit Dip

intro: Our new 95% dark bar makes these rich, chewy paleo-friendly brownies extra Wicked.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 F.

In a food processor combine dried figs, dates and raisins and pulse until finely chopped. Add beaten eggs and maple syrup and pulse until combined, then add coconut flour, baking powder and baking soda and pulse until a dough forms.
Melt coconut oil and chopped Wicked Dark chocolate over low heat in a sauce pan, add the melted chocolate mixture to the dough.
Spread mixture into a greased 11x7 inch baking pan and bake for 25 minutes.
title: Wicked Paleo Brownies

elements.name: Peak Organic's Oak Aged Mocha Stout

steps: Place a pot of water on the stove and bring to a simmer.
Whisk egg yolks and Taza Bolivian Drinking Chocolate together in a bowl large enough to sit on top of the simmering pot of water until a paste forms.
Heat milk and heavy cream in a separate saucepan until bubbles begin to form. Whisk into chocolate mixture.
Place large bowl on top of simmering water for 10 minutes.
Place mixture in a separate bowl and chill in a refrigerator until cold.
Place mixture in an ice cream maker following manufacturer instructions.
In a beer cup filled with mocha stout, scoop chocolate ice cream to float.
title: Chocolate Ice Cream and Stout Float

intro: A Taza spin on an Easter treat - our stone ground chocolate incorporated into a simple rice crispie treat recipe, then formed into nests. Perfect for any spring celebration, and a great cooking project to get the kids to make along with you.
steps: Melt the butter in a large pot, add chocolate and marshmallows and stir constantly for about 5 minutes.
Stir in the rice crispys and when cool enough to handle form into small nests, pushing jelly beans into the center.
title: Easter Bunny Nests

intro: These crunchy, salty-sweet treats on sticks will put big smiles on the faces of both grownups and kids. They’re easy to make and great for a party, or any time you want to feel like a kid again.
steps: Grease a large mixing bowl with oil. In a large lidded pot, heat vegetable oil, popcorn, and pinch of salt over high heat, shaking the pot and listening for popping.
Remove from heat when popping is less frequent and pour into greased bowl.
In a saucepan combine sugar, brown sugar, honey, and butter over medium heat and cook until 300  F measured on a candy thermometer.
Remove from heat and add baking soda, pour over popcorn using a spatula to toss and coat the popcorn. Add cacao nibs.
When popcorn is cool but still warm, wet hands and form the popcorn into balls, sticking each one with skewers.
Place chocolate in a heat proof bowl, place on top of simmering water until chocolate is melted, drizzle over popcorn balls.
Top with sprinkles. Allow to cool before serving.
title: Chocolate Caramel Popcorn Balls

intro: Tart, slightly spicy, and just a bit sweet, our cranberry chutney has an intriguing hint of cacao from Taza’s Roasted Cacao Nibs, which are a perfect pairing with the bright fruit flavors of cranberry and orange.
steps: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium high heat until shimmering, then add serrano pepper and garlic and cook about 2 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients and bring to a simmer. Cook for 12-15 minutes at medium-low heat until cranberries are soft.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, adding additional brown sugar.
title: Taza Cranberry and Cacao Nib Chutney

intro: This super simple recipe uses real pumpkin along with our cardamon tea to give you a healthy and warming drink for the holidays.
steps: Steep tea bags in hot water for 6 minutes. Squeeze tea bags upon removal to get full flavor.
Whisk tea concentrate with pumpkin puree using a wire whisk. Divide into two cups.
In a small saucepan, heat milk, vanilla extract, and honey until almost boiling. Pour evenly between existing cups.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg to taste.
title: Pumpkin Chai Tea Latte

intro: Whether you need to cool down in the summer heat, or want to generate a summery atmosphere while shying away from the poor, grey excuse for a British summer, this recipe for ice lollies made with fresh strawberries and green tea are perfect.
steps: Mix all ingredients together in a blender for about 30 seconds, divide the mixture into ice pop moulds and freeze for about 6 hours.
Enjoy!
title: Strawberry Green Tea Ice Lollies

elements.name: Ahmad Tea Earl Grey tea leaf

intro: A love for tea and cookies - the perfect combination! This recipe from Martha Stewart Cookies makes for a great gift for your tea-loving friends.
steps: Whisk flour, tea, and salt in a small bowl; set aside.
Put butter, sugar, and zest in the bowl of an electric mixer. Mix on medium speed for about 3 minutes. Reduce speed to low; slowly mix in flour and salt mixture until just combined.

Divide dough in half. Transfer each half to a piece of parchment paper; shape into logs. Roll to 1.25 inches in diameter, pressing a ruler along edge of parchment at each turn to narrow log and force out air. Transfer in parchment to paper-towel tubes; freeze 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 F. Cut logs into 1/4-inch thick slices. Space 1 inch apart on baking sheets.
Bake 13-15 minutes.
Let cool on sheets on wire racks.
title: Earl Grey Tea Cookies

steps: For one cup, simply steep your herbal infusion tea bag for about 5 minutes.
Fill a glass 1/3 with ice and add filtered water to bring it up to half the size of the glass.
Once the tea bag has steeped, pour it over the ice and mix with a spoon. Add stevia for extra sweetness and let it cool for a few minutes.
Add more ice or water if needed.
title: Iced Mixed Berries Herbal Tea

steps: In a blender, whirl blackberries until puréed. Pour through a fine strainer into a bowl, pressing pulp with a spatula to extract as much juice as possible. Discard solids.
Whisk tea and sugar into purée. Cover and chill for at least 3 hours.
Freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions until machine stops. Transfer sorbet to an airtight container and freeze about 3 hours.
title: Blackberry & Black Tea Sorbet

intro: Instead of whisking your matcha, shake it up in a cocktail shaker, then add ice, mint and lime juice.
steps: Using a cocktail shaker, shake together the water and matcha until there are no lumps.
Add ice, a squeeze of lime, handfuls of mint and shake it some more.
Pour into glasses with extra lime slices and mint.
title: matcha mint iced tea

steps: Sift your matcha so it is lump-free.
Spoon the matcha into a large mug. Add the hot water and coconut milk and whisk briskly with matcha whisk about 30 seconds.
Taste and add additional water, coconut milk, and honey.
title: matcha coconut latte

steps: Melt the white chocolate together with 1/2 cup of almond milk. Stir until smooth, then add the remaining almond milk. Set aside.
Sift matcha into 1 cup hot water and whisk with matcha whisk until combined and frothy. Stir this into the almond milk & white chocolate mixture and pour into 2 mugs.
title: matcha white hot chocolate

steps: Blend all ingredients together. Add more almond milk to thin the consistency, if necessary.
title: rooberry smoothie

steps: Sift matcha into a saucepan and add 1 tbsp of the cream.
Whisk together until no lumps remain.
Whisk in the remaining cream.
Add the white chocolate and heat over medium low heat, stirring, until the chocolate melts.
Pour into your fondue pot, and dipping with pretzel, marshmallows, cakes.
title: Matcha White Chocolate Fondue

intro: Latte season has arrived and this year we’ve ditched the Starbucks queue in favor of our own simple, yet delicious recipe.
steps: Heat the milk and chai powder together in a milk frother.
While heating, pour a generous shot of rum in a glass.
When the milk is nice and frothy, pour it into the rum-filled glass and top with a dash of cinnamon.
title: Rum Chai Latte

intro: Brighten this season with David Rio’s eggnog chai! Begin with Tiger Spice Chai and add in your favorite eggnog to ring in the holiday
steps: In David Rio signature mug, dissolve the chai in the hot milk.
Add eggnog, stir.
Garnish with cinnamon.
title: Eggnog Chai

intro: Everyone has their own way of doing things, but here, our expert tea buyers reveal their secret to making a proper pot of Yorkshire Tea.
steps: Run the tap a little so the water is nicely aerated. Use water that has boiled just once - any more than that and the level of oxygen in the water is reduced and your tea can taste a bit ‘flat’.
Warm the teapot first by swilling boiling water around inside it, then warm the cups with the water from the teapot.
For a four-cup pot, use two teabags. For loose tea, use one teaspoon per person and one for the pot.
Add freshly boiled water to the pot, stir and leave to brew for 4-5 minutes depending on how strong you like it.
If you take milk, we recommend a splash of whole or semi-skimmed milk, with sugar if you take it.
title: How to make a proper brew

steps: Mix all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker and shake until well blend.
Pour into a glass and serve.
title: The Grey Mule

steps: Mix all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker and shake until well blend.
Pour into a glass, and garnish with fresh thyme.
title: The Garden Variety

steps: Mix all liquid together in a cocktail shaker and shake until well blend.
Pour into a glass.
Muddle in fresh raspberries and blackberries.
title: Summer-ita

steps: Mix all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker and shake untill well blend.
Pour into a glass. Serve chill or on the rock.
title: Ray of Sun

steps: Mix the Classic with jalapeños in a cocktail shaker and shake until well blend.
Add sparkling water.
Pour into a glass. Serve chill or on the rock.
title: The Cleanse

steps: Mix all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker and shake until well blend.
Pour into a highball glass. Serve chilled.
title: Short + Stout

steps: Mix all liquid  in a cocktail shaker and shake until well blend.
Pour into a glass. Serve on the rock.
title: The Rye

elements.name: Copper Moon Pumpkin Spice AromaCup Coffee

steps: Blend all ingredients in a glass, stir to mix well.
Top with whipped cream, and sprinkle pumpkin pie spice and ground cinnamon.
title: Pumpkin Spice Latte

steps: Blend coffee, milk, caramel syrup, chocolate syrup in a glass, stir to mix well.
Add whipped cream, and top with drizzled thick caramel syrup.
title: Dark Chocolate Caramel
Pumpkin Spice Latte
steps: In 2-quart saucepan, heat milk, pumpkin and sugar over medium heat until hot.
Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, the vanilla and coffee.
Pour into 2 large mugs. Garnish each with whipped cream, dash pumpkin pie spice and a cinnamon stick.
Combine the first 4 ingredients and make sure sugar is dissolved. Place in a closed container.
Brine for 14-20 hours.
Combine the remaining ingredients. Place rub on dried chop for 6 hours in refrigerator.
After 6 hours, rinse off rub under cold water. Let chop dry on the counter about 30 minutes.
Heat olive oil over medium low heat. Sear both sides of chop until they are caramelized, then turn to a lower heat.
Sear both sides until meat reaches 138 C.
Remove and let rest. Serve with roasted baby potatoes and arugula, apple salad with a balsamic vinaigrette dressing.
title: Coffee Brined Pork Chop with Coffee Spiced Rub

steps: Place egg whites in the bowl of a stand mixer and whisk on low speed for about 30 seconds.
Increase speed to medium-high and beat about 90 seconds.
Reduce speed to medium. With mixer running, add half of sugar and beat about 30 seconds. Transfer whites to a large bowl.
Add egg yolks and remaining sugar to now-empty stand mixer bowl and beat at medium-high speed until pale yellow and ribbony. Add milk, espresso, cream, and alcohol and mix on low speed to combine.
Using a rubber spatula, fold the whipped whites into the egg yolk & milk mixture.
Serve by ladling into goblets and garnishing with espresso beans.
title: Cappuccino Eggnog

steps: Put the first 4 ingredients in a quart jar and stir. Cover and refrigerate overnight to make coffee base.
Pour the coffee base through a strainer into a bowl, then strain back into jar for easy storage.
For each drink: Fill a tall glass halfway with ice. Pour in coffee until glass is about 3/4 full, and add milk to taste.
title: Magical Coffee

elements.name: The Republic of Tea Sweet Tea Classic Black Tea

steps: Steep 4 tea bags Sweet Tea Classic Black Tea in 1 cup of boiling water for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and add 1 cup of seltzer and 2 cups of ice. Squeeze lemon to taste.
Shake in a beverage shaker, pour into ice-filled glasses and garnish with a slice of lemon and blackberry.
title: Sweet Tea Classic Black Tea Blackberry Sparkler

steps: Steep Republic Chai Full-Leaf Loose tea in boiling water for 5 minutes.
Add Chai Spice Honey and ice.
Shake in a classic beverage shaker and pour into ice-filled glasses.
Top with whipped cream.
title: Republic Chai Caramel Latte

elements.name: The Republic of Tea’s Agave Nectar

steps: Bring water to a boil.
Place hibiscus tea bags into a heat-resistant tea pitcher. Pour in boiling water and allow to steep for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and stir in The Republic of Tea’s Agave Nectar and fresh pineapple juice.
Combine cooled tea with sparkling water and pour over ice to serve.
Float each glass with a splash of pineapple juice and garnish with pineapple slices.
title: Pineapple Hibiscus Tea Sparkler

steps: Steep Emperor’s 100% White Tea Bags in 2 cups of water just short of boiling for 1 minute.
Remove tea bags and add ice.
Shake in a beverage shaker, pour into ice-filled glasses and garnish with mint and cucumber.
title: Emperor’s White Cucumber Mint Refresher

elements.name: The Republic of Tea’s Agave Nectar

steps: Bring water to a boil and pour over Hibiscus tea bags into a heat-resistant pitcher.
Allow to infuse for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags. Stir in Agave Nectar. Place in refrigerator to chill.
Combine chilled tea, strawberries and orange juice in a blender. Pour over ice to serve.
title: Berry Hibiscus Cooler

elements.name: The Republic of Tea’s Agave Nectar
Bel Air Iced Tea Serving Pitcher

steps: Bring filtered water just to a boil.
Place Jasmine Jazz Full-Leaf Green in a glass iced tea pitcher, add boiling water and infuse for 3 minutes.
Remove tea and allow to cool.
Add agave nectar and freshly squeezed lime juice.
Garnish with fresh lime slices.
title: Iced jasmine tea with fresh lime

intro: Double up on Iced Green Tea with our crisp TAKEYA Spring Green Chinese sencha mixed with a Japanese Matcha green tea powder and a hint of agave for sweetness.
steps: Tear open the TAKEYA Spring Green Iced T-PACs, pour tea into Tea Infuser and twist into lid.
Heat water to a boil, cool for 4 minutes and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 3 minutes.
Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser and stir in the matcha green tea. Stir in the agave.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds to flash chill. Remove 2 cups of the iced tea to make room for the fruit infusion. Shake for 30 seconds immediately before serving.
title: Spring Green Matcha Ice Tea

intro: Who needs artificial, sugary drinks when you have this naturally fruity, caffeine-free Hibiscus Pomegranate iced tea infusion to enjoy with your kids? Use fresh cranberries or frozen anytime. Just imagine, a healthy drink your kids will actually ask for!
steps: Tear open the TAKEYA Hibiscus Pomegranate Iced T-PACs, pour into Tea Infuser and twist into lid.

Heat water to a boil, cool for 1 minute and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 7 minutes. Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser. Stir in honey until dissolved.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds to flash chill. Remove 1.5 cups of the iced herbal blend to make room for fruit infusion.

Twist the Fruit Infuser into Infuser Extender and add chopped cranberries and raspberries. Twist the Fruit Infuser into the lid, lower it into the iced herbal blend and seal airtight. Zip on the Thermo Jacket and infuse for 3 hours in the refrigerator.
title: Cran-Raspberry Ice Tea

intro: Classic iced tea lemonade has a wild cousin – and you’re about to become acquainted. Featuring brisk Enchanted Black Iced Tea, pure honey, fresh lemon juice and a vodka of your choice.
steps: Tear open the TAKEYA Enchanted Black Iced T-PACs, pour tea into Tea Infuser and twist into lid.

Heat water to a boil, cool for 1 minute and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 5 minutes. Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser. Stir in honey until dissolved.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds to flash chill. Remove 2.5 cups of the iced tea.

Top off iced tea with vodka. Twist the Citrus Juicer into the top of the pitcher and juice the lemons. Twist off the Citrus Juicer, seal and shake to mix. Zip on the Thermo Jacket and refrigerator for at least 3 hours before serving.
title: Classic Half & Half Ice Tea

intro: It’s summertime anytime with this caffeine-free Coconut Vibe iced tea infusion. Add a chilled burst of flavor to your glass with 1-inch cubes of frozen pineapple before serving.
steps: Tear open the TAKEYA Coconut Vibe Iced T-PACs, pour into Tea Infuser along with the dried coconut flakes. Twist the Tea Infuser into the lid.

Heat water to a boil, cool for 1 minute and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 7 minutes. Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser. Stir in honey until dissolved.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds to flash chill. Remove 1.5 cups of the iced herbal blend to make room for infusion.
Twist the Citrus Juicer into the top of the pitcher and juice the limes. Twist off the Citrus Juicer, seal and shake to mix.

Twist the Fruit Infuser into the Infuser Extender and add chopped pineapple. Twist the Fruit Infuser into the lid, lower it into the iced herbal blend and seal airtight. Zip on the Thermo Jacket and infuse for 3 hours in the refrigerator.
title: Coconut, Pineapple & Lime Ice Tea

intro: If it sounds like a unique and exotic combination, that’s because it is. The crisp flavor of Spring Green Iced Tea is infused with earthy basil and naturally sweet mint to refresh your senses and balance the rich honey, tart lemon juice and fruity strawberries.
steps: Add chopped mint and basil to the bottom of the pitcher and muddle. Tear open the TAKEYA Spring Green Iced T-PACs, pour tea into Tea Infuser and twist into lid.

Heat water to a boil, cool for 4 minutes and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 3 minutes. Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser. Stir in honey until dissolved.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds to flash chill. Remove 2.5 cups of the iced tea to make room for infusion.
Twist the Citrus Juicer into the top of the pitcher and juice the lemons. Twist off the Citrus Juicer, seal and shake to mix.

Twist the Fruit Infuser into the Infuser Extender and add chopped strawberries. Twist the Fruit Infuser into the lid, lower it into the iced tea and seal airtight. Zip on the Thermo Jacket and infuse for 3 hours in the refrigerator.
title: Strawberry, Basil & Mint Lemonade

intro: Tropical Black Iced Tea, lemon, lime, lavender blossoms and a joyful splash of tequila. A south-of-the-border treat that’s somewhere north of awesome.
steps: Twist the Citrus Juicer into the top of the pitcher and juice the lemons. Twist off the Citrus Juicer and pour lemon juice into medium pot on the stove. Add dried lavender blossoms to the Tea Infuser. Tear open one TAKEYA Tropical Black T-PAC, pour tea into Tea Infuser and twist into lid.

In medium pot, add water to lemon juice. Bring to a boil, cool for 1 minute, and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 5 minutes. Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser. Stir in sugar until dissolved.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds. Remove 13 oz of to make room for infusion.

Top off iced tea with tequila. Twist the Fruit Infuser into the Infuser Extender and add lemon and lime slices. Twist the Fruit Infuser into the lid, lower it into the iced tea and seal airtight. Zip on the Thermo Jacket and Infuse in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving.
title: Lavender Lemonade Cocktail

intro: Enjoy a lush tropical getaway – no airfare required. Fresh papaya and kiwi play upon the fruity notes in this Tropical Black iced tea infusion. Subtly sweetened with honey, the slightly tart lime juice awakens your taste buds.
steps: Tear open the TAKEYA Tropical Black Iced T-PACs, pour tea into Tea Infuser and twist into lid.

Heat water to a boil, cool for 1 minute and fill the pitcher halfway. Lower the lid with attached Tea Infuser into the hot water, allowing steam to vent, and brew for 5 minutes. Remove the lid and detach the Tea Infuser. Stir in honey until dissolved.
Top off with ice, seal lid and shake for 30 seconds to flash chill. Remove 1.5 cups of the iced tea to make room for infusion.
Twist the Citrus Juicer into the top of the pitcher and juice the lime. Twist off the Citrus Juicer, seal and shake to mix.

Twist the Fruit Infuser into the Infuser Extender and add chopped papaya and kiwi. Twist the Fruit Infuser into the lid, lower it into the iced tea and seal airtight. Zip on the Thermo Jacket and infuse for 3 hours in the refrigerator before serving.
title: Papaya, Kiwi & Lime Ice Tea

elements.name: Tea Forte Earl Grey loose leaf tea

steps: Heat oven to 375 F.
Pulse together all the dry ingredients in a food processor until the tea leaves are pulverized. Add the vanilla, water and the butter. Pulse together until a dough is formed.
Divide the dough in half. Place each half on a sheet of plastic wrap and roll into a 12-inch log, 2 inches in diameter. Chill for 30 minutes.
Slice each log into disks, 1/3 inch thick.
Bake about 12 minutes.
Let cool on sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire racks.
title: Earl Grey Tea Cookies

steps: Pour boiling water over White Ginger Pear pyramid infusers and brew 5 minutes. Remove infusers; set aside.
In a 12-inch skillet, bring tea, green onion and ginger to a boil over high heat. Add fillets.
Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 6 minutes.
Remove fillets to serving platter and sprinkle with chopped green onion.
title: White Ginger Pear Poached Tilapia

elements.name: Tru Table Asian Sweet Chili & Tamari

steps: Cook noodles. When finished, place noodles in an ice water bath to cool. Drain and set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine sesame oil, prepared vegetables and noodles.
Garnish with sesame seeds and peanuts.
Toss with Tru Table Asian Sweet Chili & Tamari and enjoy!
title: Chilled Asian Noodle Salad

elements.name: Tru Table Key Lime with Asiago Caesar Dressing

steps: Preheat oven to 400 F.
Rub inside of cleaned spaghetti squash halves with olive oil and chopped garlic.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place squash on a baking sheet pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes.
Let rest 10-15 min.
Run tines of fork lengthwise over cut surface of squash to loosen spaghetti-like strands; scoop out strands.
Combine Tru Table Key Lime Caesar with Asiago Dressing and 2/3 cup cheese in small bowl. Fold into squash; place in ovenproof casserole dish. Top with remaining cheese.
Bake 25 min.
title: Baked Spaghetti Squash Casserole

steps: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Prepare Brie cheese by running a paring knife around the top of the cheese 1/4 inch in from the edge, cutting through the rind. Make cross cuts across the top and remove top rind.
Place cheese on a heatproof serving dish and bake 15 minutes.
Heat the Apricot Jam in a small saucepan over medium low heat until it bubbles. Turn off heat and add the brandy. Stir until combined. Pour jam over heated Brie.
Serve warm with French bread toasts, fresh strawberries and sliced apples.
title: Apricot Brandy Brie

steps: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Combine all ingredients in a medium size bowl and mix.
Transfer dip into a greased baking dish.
Bake dip 20-30 minutes until heated through and bubbly.
Serve with crackers.
title: Crab and Artichoke Dip

steps: Preheat oven to 400 F.
Slice plum tomatoes lengthwise into eighths. Remove seeds.
Place tomatoes on a foil lined and greased baking pan. Sprinkle with vinegar, olive oil and sugar. Bake in oven 20-30 minutes.
Cook pasta according to package directions and drain.
Combine pasta, pesto, artichoke hearts, olives, pine nuts, salt and pepper. Toss gently until pasta is well coated with pesto. Add the roasted tomatoes and toss.
Garnish with Parmesan cheese and serve.
title: Pesto Pasta with Oven Roasted Tomatoes

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Butter Chicken Simmering Sauce

steps: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
Heat oil and butter in a large heavy straight sided sauté pan over medium-high heat until it shimmers.
Add chicken in small batches and sauté until they are a rich golden brown on all sides.
When all batches are done, drain any remaining fat.
Return chicken to pan and add Butter Chicken Sauce. Simmer 10-15 minutes until hot.
Serve over jasmine rice and garnish with chopped cilantro.
title: Butter Chicken

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Coq Au Vin Simmering Sauce

steps: Pat chicken pieces dry and season with salt and pepper.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large straight sided saute pan over medium-high heat until it shimmers. Add chicken in small batches and cook until golden brown and crisp on all sides. Remove all but 2 tbsp of fat.
Return chicken to pan and add Coq Au Vin Simmering Sauce.
Reduce heat and simmer covered for 30 minutes. Remove lid and simmer an additional 15 minutes.
Remove chicken to a large serving platter and top with sauce, garnish with chopped parsley.
title: Coq Au Vin

steps: Preheat oven to 450 F.
Roll out pie dough. Cut 36 rounds. Press each pastry round into 2 1/4-inch tartlet pans.
Bake in oven for 8-12 minutes until golden brown.
Combine cream cheese and condensed milk in a bowl. Using a hand mixer, mix on medium speed until uniform. Mix in Key Lime Curd on low speed until combined.
Spoon mixture into prepared crusts and refrigerate at least 4 hours.
Serve with sweetened whipped cream and lime zest garnish.
title: Key Lime Tartlets

steps: Core strawberries. Slice a small piece of the tip of the strawberry off so it will stand.
Whip cream in a chilled batter bowl with the whisk attachment of a hand mixer until soft peaks form. Whisk in sugar. Remove to medium-size bowl and set aside.
Whisk together the cream cheese and lemon curd. Fold whipped cream into cheese mixture until uniformly mixed. Chill until ready to use.
Spoon lemon cream mixture into each strawberry. Top with a blueberry and garnish with a mint leaf.
title: Lemon Cream Filled Strawberries

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen New England Cocktail Sauce
Stonewall Kitchen California Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps: Cut tomato tops off. Remove seeds, keeping tomato intact.
Roast corn over grill.
Remove corn from cob with a corn peeler.
Saute corn in pan with small amount of oil. While warm, toss corn with cocktail sauce, diced red peppers, salt and pepper to taste.
Remove corn from pan. Add cilantro leaves to corn mixture.
Stuff tomatoes with roasted corn mixture. Arrange on a plate.
Drizzle olive oil over stuffed tomatoes.
Garnish plate with diced red peppers.
title: Roasted Corn Stuffed Tomatoes

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Habanero Mango Hot Sauce

steps: Place the cream cheese, shredded cheese, bell peppers, scallions, Habanero Mango Hot Sauce or Mild Tomato Salsa in the bowl. With a hand mixer, mix on medium speed until uniformly mixed.
Shape cheese mixture into the shape of a small pumpkin.
Crush some of the Yellow Tortilla Chips in a plastic bag using a rolling pin. Press crushed chips over all sides of the pumpkin shaped cheese ball.
Top with the stem of the bell pepper. Serve cheese ball with remaining Yellow Tortilla Chips or crackers.
title: Habanero Mango Pumpkin Shaped Cheese Ball

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Farmhouse Pancake & Waffle Mix

steps: Beat egg and milk together. Add dry mix and blend well. Stir in 1 tbsp melted butter and mix thoroughly.
Ladle onto 350 F griddle and flip when air bubbles begin to pop. Turn once and cook until done.
Melt 1 tbsp butter in a medium-large sauté pan. Core apple and slice about 1/2-inch thick. Add apple slices to sauté pan and cook until almost tender.
Add Maine Maple Syrup and cinnamon. Sauté several minutes.
Serve hot over pancakes.
title: Cinnamon Apple Farmhouse Pancakes

steps: Place cream cheese in a medium size microwaveable bowl.
In a sauté pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add the shallots and sauté about 4 minutes. Add the chopped pecans and sauté for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Place the corned beef in a food processor and pulse until crumbly.
Microwave the cream cheese until soft and warm. Stir in the sour cream and Horseradish Mustard.
Add shallot mixture and crumbled corned beef, mix well. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped chives.
Serve with Olive Oil Crackers.
title: Irish Corned Beef Dip

steps: Place steak and Roadhouse Steak Sauce in a shallow pan. Marinate 2-6 hours.
Grill steak basting with Roadhouse Steak Sauce until desired doneness. Slice thin.
Toss sliced vegetables with olive oil and add salt and pepper to taste. Grill vegetables in a grill basket until tender crisp.
Heat tortillas on grill on each side until warm, but not crisp.
Arrange meat and vegetables down the center of the grilled tortilla and wrap.
title: Roadhouse Beef Fajita

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Chocolate Chip Pancake & Waffle Mix
Dark Chocolate Sea Salt Caramel Sauce

steps: For the waffles - whisk together the egg, milk, Chocolate Chip Pancake & Waffle Mix and butter until uniformly blended. Cook waffle batter in a greased waffle maker until golden brown. Allow waffles to cool on a rack.

Mix the ricotta, mascarpone, confectioner's sugar and vanilla in a medium bowl until well blended. In a separate bowl whisk the cream until stiff peaks form. Fold the ricotta mixture and chocolate chips into the whipped cream. Warm the chocolate sauce 15-30 seconds in the microwave.
For the nut topping combine the pistachios, cherries and mini chocolate chips in a bowl and mix.
Place waffles on serving plates. Divide the cannoli topping on each waffle. Drizzle with chocolate sauce and sprinkle nut topping over the top.
title: Cannoli Waffle

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen New England Corn Chowder

steps: In a large pot, bring the chicken broth and potatoes to a boil.
Add the soup mix and reduce to a simmer. Cover the pot and simmer for 30 minutes.
In a medium skillet, melt the butter and sauté the shallot and garlic over medium heat until just softened.
Toss the shrimp with the Maine Seafood Rub.
Increase the heat and add the shrimp and sauté until the shrimp begin to brown.
After the soup has simmered for 30 minutes, add the heavy cream, dill and celery salt.
Return to a simmer and add the shrimp, garlic and shallot mixture. Taste for seasoning and add the cayenne and a small squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve with Cheddar Chive Biscuits.
title: Corn and Shrimp Chowder

steps: For the dressing, in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk mayonnaise, Country Ketchup, Farmhouse Green Relish, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste until smooth.
For the salad, combine the shrimp, cucumber and tomatoes in a large mixing bowl. Add dressing to taste and toss.
Serve shrimp over greens and garnish with lemon wedges and bread.
title: Downeast Shrimp Salad

steps: Melt butter in a skillet.
Sauté onions, garlic and jalapeno until soft.
Add the Honey Barbecue Sauce and tomatoes and stir to blend.
Add the meatballs and simmer on low heat for about 30 minutes.
Add cilantro and salt and pepper to taste.
title: Cowboy Meatballs

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Tikka Masala Simmering Sauce

steps: Combine Tikka Masala Sauce and yogurt in a medium-size bowl. Add chicken and stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate. Allow to marinate 1-2 hours.
Place chicken on a greased foil lined rimmed baking sheet. Broil chicken until the internal temperature is 160 F.
Flip chicken breasts halfway through cooking. Cut cooked chicken into 1-inch cubes.
Pour Tikka Masala Sauce into a sauté pan. Add chicken and juices and simmer over medium-low heat 15-30 minutes. Add chicken stock to thin sauce.
title: Tikka Masala

steps: Cream Horseradish Aioli and cream cheese together until smooth.
Spread aioli mixture on each cracker. Top with shrimp or salmon.
Garnish with scallions and herbs.
title: Salmon & Shrimp Pita Appetizers

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Wild Maine Blueberry Syrup

steps: Scoop shaved ice into individual bowls.
Drizzle syrup and  ream over the top.
title: Maple on Snow

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Blue Corn Tortilla Chips

steps: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In an oven safe platter layer blue and white corn chips.
Top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Add your favorite sliced or diced veggies: green pepper, olives, onions.
Heat until the cheese melts and top with Spicy Tomato Salsa, sour cream and guacamole.
title: Nachos Grande

steps: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Place squash halves in a baking dish, filled with 1/2 inch water. Cover squash with foil.
Bake for 1 hour.
Scoop the pulp into a bowl, mash with the Cranberry Horseradish Sauce and butter. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Put the filling back into the squash shells and serve.
title: Baked Acorn Squash with Cranberry Horseradish Sauce

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Roasted Apple Grille Sauce

steps: In a deep skillet, cover chicken with water. Bring to a boil and simmer until the chicken breasts are cooked through. Cool.
Chop the chicken into bite size pieces.
Combine all ingredients and serve chilled on crusty bread as a sandwich.
title: Roasted Apple Chicken Salad

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen California Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps: Toss scallops with California Extra Virgin Olive Oil and place flat side down in a cast iron skillet pan heated to medium-high.
Cook both sides to brown.
Remove from pan and place scallops in a puddle of Wasabi Ginger Sauce and garnish plate with sprig of fresh chive.
title: Pan Seared Scallops with Wasabi Ginger Sauce

steps: In a large bowl combine the Traditional Marinara Sauce, cream, green onion, basil and shredded cheese. Mix well.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and add to bowl with sauce. Toss until uniformly mixed.
Place pasta in a greased pie dish. Top with remaining cheese.
Bake in 350 F oven for 20-30 minutes.
title: Tomato Basil Pasta Pie

steps: Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease a 9x5 loaf pan.
Combine the beef, pork, onion, Farmhouse Red Relish, tomato sauce, breadcrumbs, egg and salt. Mix thoroughly and place in the loaf pan.
Combine the Ketchup and brown sugar. Spread this mixture over the meat loaf.
Bake 1-1.25 hours until the meat loaf is firm and has an internal temperature of 160 F.
Remove meat loaf from the oven and drain off fat and cool 15 minutes before serving.
title: Meat Loaf

elements.name: Stonewall Kitchen Roasted Garlic Basil Sauce

intro: An easy to make dinner with wine and fresh crusty bread. A completely perfect meal.
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Cover saucepan with olive oil. On medium heat, add eggplant and onions to cook until eggplant is dark brown, stirring occasionally.
When the eggplant is soft, add one cup of water. Stir, scraping the bottom of the pan.
Add pasta sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. Pour over pasta and top with lots of Parmesan cheese.
title: Penne with Eggplant

elements.name: Tenderbelly Honey Glazed Spiral Cut Ham

intro: Ham and cheese never looked so good. Try this easy Monte Cristo Sandwich for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
steps: Beat eggs in a shallow dish along with a few pinches of salt and pepper. Set aside.
Assemble sandwiches, with mustard, mayonnaise, ham, cheese, salt and pepper. Slightly compress sandwich.
Over medium heat melt butter in skillet.
Dip and coat each sandwich in beaten egg, and place in skillet. Cook sandwiches 2-3 minutes on each side, until browned and cheese has melted.
Top with powdered sugar.
title: MONTE CRISTO SANDWICH

elements.name: Tenderbelly Honey Glazed Spiral Cut Ham

intro: A perfect way to use leftover ham for an easy main dish or a fun appetizer.
steps: Prepare grill.
Assemble ham and pineapple on skewers in alternating pattern.
Place skewers over indirect heat on grill, and baste occasionally with pineapple juice, turning kabobs after 3-4 minutes on each side.
title: GRILLED PINEAPPLE HAM KABOBS RECIPE

steps: Toast your bread so it has some color.
Spread on a thick layer of salted butter and top with a generous amount of kaya.
Top with another slice of buttered toast.
title: Coconut Jam on Toast

elements.name: Fat Toad Farm Original Goat’s Milk Caramel

steps: Fill a pudding cup half way with chocolate pudding.
Pour a layer of Fat Toad Farm Goat’s Milk Caramel on top of the pudding layer.
Dollop a final layer of Vermont Creamery Creme Fraiche on top.
Stab it with a pretzel stick for a little savory kick.
title: Chocolate Pudding With Caramel & Vermont Creamery Creme Fraiche

elements.name: Fat Toad Farm Cinnamon Goat’s Milk Caramel

steps: Core 4 Macintosh apples. Place in 8x8 baking pan.
Put a dollop of butter in cored center of each apple.
Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.
Pour Fat Toad Farm Cinnamon Goat’s Milk Caramel in the center and drizzle on top.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
title: Caramel Baked Apples From Fat Toad Farm

intro: This technique can be used to combine any of your favorite Spicemode Cooking Sauces with beans for a tasty spread or dip. I have used the on a sandwich, for a veggie platter or simply with crackers.
steps: In the bowl of a food process combine Madras Cooking Sauce, chickpeas, coconut milk, coconut oil, coconut flakes and lemon juice.
Combine until smooth. Add more coconut milk if too thick.
Season with salt and enjoy.
title: Chickpea Hummus with Madras Cooking Sauce

intro: Chickpea or Channa Masala is one of those hearty, simple, fragrant dishes that always tastes great. It is a staple in Northern Indian households and is a super quick to prepare using our cooking sauces and organic canned beans. Spicemode combine chickpeas with white bean, smashing them halfway through the cooking process to give the sauce a thicker consistency.
steps: Add Masala Cooking Sauce to a skillet, over medium heat, and saute until fragrant. Add both cans of beans and stir until combined.
Add enough water to slightly cover the beans, and simmer on medium low heat for 5 minutes.
Use a spoon to smash some beans; continue to cook until the sauce thickens and beans are tender.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve over rice or with naan.
title: Chickpea + White Bean Masala

intro: This soulful dish comes together in minutes and tastes like you cooked for hours.
steps: Add oil to the pan over medium high heat, tip in cans of beans. Add spoonfuls of Vindaloo Cooking Sauce until nicely coated, stir to combine and cook until fragrant and starting to sizzle.
Add can of tomatoes, coconut milk and simmer over medium heat until beans are tender and sauce thickens.
Taste and add salt and pepper. Garnish with handful of chopped scallions and cilantro.
title: Pinto Beans with Vindaloo Cooking Sauce

intro: Want to impress all of your friends at your next dinner shindig? Meet the Grilled Vindaloo Fire Skirt Steak Taco. Taking tacos where they’ve never been before, Vindaloo Fire Seasoning gets the party started. Bold, smoky flavor balanced with spicy notes ascend these bad boys to a another level. Simple recipe, yet so delicious!
steps: Cut off excess fat around sides of steak. Add a generous amount of Spicemode Vindaloo Fire seasoning.
Allow to rest for 15 minutes.
Combine scallions and cilantro. Crumble cheese.
Once hot, allow steak to grill for 4 minutes on each side. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into 4″ pieces then slice across the grain.
