Add sliced steak to tortilla. Top with cilantro, scallions, queso, and lime juice.
title: Grilled Vindaloo Fire Skirt Steak Taco

steps: In a blender combine cucumber, mint, lime juice, Morris Kitchen Ginger Syrup and gin, blend until smooth.
Add water and blend for 5 seconds to incorporate.
Fill the ice pop molds 3/4 full with the cucumber and ginger mixture. Place molds in freezer for 1 hour and then put the ice pop sticks in the mold.
Freeze for 12 hours before serving.
title: Gin Gin Cucumber Popsicles

steps: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, add Morris Kitchen Grenadine Syrup and lemonade.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled beer glass.
Slowly top with beer.
title: Monaco

steps: Combine and hear to a simmer. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a citrus peel.
title: Morris Kitchen Mulled Cider

elements.name: Morris Kitchen Bear Pond Espresso Syrup

steps: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.
Strain into a cocktail coupe and garnish with freshly cracked coffee beans.
title: Bear Pond Cocktail
Oysters on the Half Shell with Mignonette Sauce
steps: in a small bowl, stir together wine, vinegar, shallots, red pepper flakes and black pepper.
Place the bowl of mignonette sauce surrounding it with ice.
Using an oyster knife, slip the tip of the knife into the shell and pry upward to open, lift off the top shell. Run the knife underneath the oyster to free it from the bottom shell.
Garnish the platter with lemon wedges and parsley sprigs and serve immediately.
Preheat an oven to 375 F.
In a deep sauté pan over medium-high heat, combine the honey and bay leaves and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium and continue to simmer about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat.

Place the butter pieces in the pan. Using tongs, place a pear half on top of each piece of butter. Cover the pan, transfer to the oven and cook for 10 minutes, then turn the pears over and baste with the honey mixture. Drizzle the pears with the amaretto.
Return the pan, uncovered, to the oven and cook 6-8 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool about 30 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth. Place the pear halves in bowls, top with the yogurt and sprinkle with the almonds. Drizzle some of the honey syrup over the pears and serve.
title: Roasted Pears with Honey and Yogurt

steps: Preheat an oven to 375 F. Lightly grease a baking dish with the olive oil.
Place the chicken breasts in the prepared baking dish. Arrange the tomatoes around the chicken. Drizzle with the vinegar and 2.5 tsp olive oil. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper.
Top each chicken breast with 2 lemon slices. Arrange the tarragon sprigs and sage leaves over and around the chicken. Drizzle the remaining 2 tsp olive oil over the herbs.
Bake 25-30 minutes.
Drizzle with some pan juices and serve.
title: Baked Chicken with Cherry Tomatoes, Herbs and Lemon

steps: In a fry pan over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add apples, 1/2 cup sugar, cornstarch, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg and 1/4 tsp salt. Cook 18 minutes, set aside.
Remove from the heat and stir in 2 tsp vanilla.
Preheat the waffle maker on medium-high heat. Preheat an oven to 200 F.

In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolks, buttermilk, the 8 tbsp melted butter and 1/2 tsp vanilla. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, 1/3 cup sugar, and 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg and 1/2 tsp salt. Add the flour mixture to the yolk mixture and whisk until smooth.
In another bowl, using an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the egg whites on medium-high speed about 1 minute. Fold the whites into the batter.
Pour 1/3 cup batter into each well of the waffle maker. Cook 5 to 6 minutes.
Transfer to a wire rack set on a baking sheet. Repeat to cook the remaining batter.
Serve the waffles hot with the caramelized apples and whipped cream.
title: Cinnamon Waffles with Caramelized Apples

elements.name: El Marques Herbed Olive Oil Butter

intro: Delicious roasted chicken with El Marques Herbed Olive Butter, lemon and pepper. The best cooking recipe for your next Thanksgiving!
steps: Stuff the chicken with lemons and dried rosemary sprigs.
Use a sharp knife to detach skin from chicken in breast area, and spread generous amount of El Marques Herbed Olive Oil Butter under the skin.
Apply more olive oil butter to coat the whole chicken.
Sprinkle salt, black pepper and smoked paprika on top of the chicken.
Transfer the prepared chicken to a Nuwave owen. Set to high and bake 1 hour.
Serve warm!
title: El Marques Roasted Chicken with Herbed Olive Butter

elements.name: Calivirgin Buddha’s Hand Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps: Combine the peas, cumin, onion, and garlic in the container of a food processor.
Process until smooth. Add lemon juice and Calivirgin olive oil, and process to blend.
Season with red pepper flakes, salt and pepper.
Serve with tortilla chips.
title: Sweet Pea Mockamole

elements.name: Calivirgin Hot Virgin Jalapeno Olive Oil

intro: These are very easy to make and the contrast between the sweet and spicy sauce with the savory bacon and the crunch and cool of the chestnut makes it so that you can’t try just one of them.
steps: To make Calivirgin mayo, combine egg, garlic, lemon juice, and mustard in blender.  Blend until smooth, then on low speed slowly drizzle the olive oil in.
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Wrap each water chestnut with a piece of bacon. Place the rolls seam-side down on a baking sheet.
Bake in the oven for 30 minutes. Drain off the grease.
In a small bowl, stir together the Calivirgin mayo, brown sugar and chili sauce.
Submerge each piece in the sauce and place back on pan with seam-side down.
Bake for another 25 minutes.
title: Bacon Wrapped Water Chestnuts

intro: When it comes to popcorn for the Superbowl; throwing a bowl of boring popcorn on the table will surely be passed up.  When I do popcorn I’m serious about it, so you will not find any boring popcorn at my house.  Adding flavored oils, shaved hard cheeses like Gruyere or Parmigiano-Reggiano, and green onion or chives is what brings this simple snack to a whole new level.
title: Not So Boring Popcorn

elements.name: Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil

intro: This is a wonderful, easy salad. The main ingredients are Olive Oil, Garlic and Potato so use a really fine Extra Virgin Olive Oil.
steps: Boil potatoes with skin on in water with a bit of olive oil and salt. Remove from heat, drain and peel the potatoes.
Cut into chunks and place in a bowl.
Use minced garlic, seasoned sea salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.
Add generous amount of Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil to hold the salad together.
Garnish with parsley and Sandy Oaks olives.
title: Mediterranean Potato Salad

elements.name: Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil

intro: This flavorful dish is a perfect addition to a spread of tapas or mezze served with Sangria. Serve this dish with slices of French bread, pita bread or Spanish breads. Accompany it, if you like, with a variety of olives, hummus, fresh fruit or other Mediterranean influenced snacks.
steps: Heat a large sauté pan over high heat and add the olive oil.
Season the chicken with salt and pepper and place it in the hot pan. Sauté the chicken until nicely browned. Remove to a plate.
In the same pan, wilt the shallots and garlic, and add the chorizo and sauté until nicely browned.
Remove to the plate with the chicken.
Deglaze the pan with the sherry vinegar.
Add the apple cider, bring to a boil and reduce by half.
Return the chicken and chorizo to the pan and heat through. Taste and adjust the seasonings.
Before serving, stir in the grapes, chopped red pepper and parsley.
title: Chorizo and Chicken in a Sherry Cider Vinaigrette

elements.name: Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil

intro: This is a beautiful and refreshing salad with contrasting flavors of sliced oranges and black olives arranged on a bed of arugula. It’s one of my favorites and often requested by my friends.
steps: Mix together extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar and the juice of 1 orange. Add the raisins, orange zest, salt and a couple of sprigs of mint leaves.
2 hours before serving, peel 4 oranges and slice them. Put them in a dish and pour part of the dressing.
Arrange the arugula in a shallow serving dish. Arrange the orange slices over the arugula. Scatter the olives on top and add the rest of the salad dressing.
Top with thinly slice purple onions.
title: Orange & Black Olive Salad on a Bed of Arugula

elements.name: Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps: Combine polenta, chicken stock and milk in a large saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer over low heat until thickened.
Add more stock, milk until polenta is cooked. Stir in the parmesan and butter to mix.
Taste and adjust seasonings.
Pour into a parchment line baking pan and refrigerate.
When polenta is firm and cold, cut into shapes. Drizzle with Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil.
title: Basic Polenta

elements.name: Sandy Oaks Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps: Cut 8 1-inch thick croutons. Toast each on one side only. Place two of the croutons, toasted side up, on dessert dish.
Brush each crouton generously with olive oil. Rub each of the toasted oil-coated croutons with the cut end of a garlic clove.
Parboil the figs in a small pan of boiling water for 30 seconds. Dunk the figs in ice water briefly, and drain on paper towels.
Place two figs side by side on the croutons.
Sprinkle each crostini with 1 tbsp of mild Gorgonzola cheese.
Drizzle each crostini, and the plate surrounding it, with 1 tbsp of honey.
Drizzle the edge of each plate with 1/4 tsp of extra virgin olive oil.
Sprinkle Herbs de Province on each crostini, and grind a little mignonette pepper mixed with whole allspice berries.
Garnish the place with a couple of sprigs of fresh basil.
title: Crostini with Figs and Honey
